ERRORS.REPOSITORY-NOT-FOUND: Repository not found or you have no rights on it
ERRORS.INVALID-URLS: One or more URLs are not well formatted !

README-STRUCTURE.TITLE: ReadMe structure
README-STRUCTURE.MESSAGE: The readme format of each repository must follow the format below strictly.

INTRO.TITLE: Introduction
INTRO.MESSAGE: Git4School is an application that helps teachers follow the progress of their students during practical work sessions using Github. From the monitoring over time of student commits to the completion rate of each question by the TP group, as well as the distribution of the types of commits of each student (before / after a correction...), the teacher has access to several tools to best support his students during the practical work sessions.

OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.1: You can enter questions to filter the commits and milestones dealing with the entered question(s)
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.2: You can select one of the TP groups to display only the students and milestones of the group
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.3: You can show or hide annotations (sessions, reviews, corrections, others)
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.4: Press this button or press the "space" bar to reset the zoom
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.5: Press the button to switch between the 2 zoom modes: zoom with the mouse cursor / zoom with the mouse wheel and move with the cursor
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.6: Press the button to switch between 3 time scales (note that the time scale adapts in real time with the zoom level)
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.7: Press the button to download an archive containing the updated configuration file and 2 files with the data generated by the application
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.9: Reads the previously uploaded file again
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.INTRO: This page lets the teacher follow the work of his students using a graph displaying the commits of each student (on the y axis) according to time (on the abscissa) as well as the sessions of TP, reviews and corrections
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.INFO-1: Only the questions defined in the configuration file can be selected (can be modified in the "metadata" tab)
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.INFO-5: The button icon indicates the zoom mode you are using
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.INFO-5-BTN-WHEEL: zoom with the mouse wheel and pan
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.INFO-6: The button icon indicates the current time scale
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.INFO-8: If the file is not a valid JSON file, or if the mandatory fields are not filled in or in the wrong format, an error message will be sent and the data will not be loaded
OVERVIEW-TOOLBAR.INFO-9: Using this button allows you to read a file you have just modified without having to upload it again or refresh the data

OVERVIEW.1: Clicking anywhere on the graph (on no element) opens a window to create a milestone
OVERVIEW.2: Clicking on a milestone opens a window to edit a milestone
OVERVIEW.3: Hovering the mouse over a commit displays details about it and clicking on it opens its Github page in a new tab
OVERVIEW.INFO: To perform these actions, it is necessary to use the zoom mode with the mouse wheel

STUDENTS-COMMITS.1: You can select one of the TP groups to display only the students of the group
STUDENTS-COMMITS.2: Moving the cursor delimits the maximum date for which commits are computed
STUDENTS-COMMITS.3: Passing the cursor over a bar displays details on the type of commit the bar corresponds to
STUDENTS-COMMITS.4: It is possible to click on any element of the legend to hide it or not on the graph
STUDENTS-COMMITS.INTRO: This page displays a graph with the distribution of commit types for each student. This allows, when related to the total number of commits and the advancement in the student's questions, to have an indication of how the student works, and to identify possible difficulties
STUDENTS-COMMITS.INFO-2: The minimum date that can be chosen corresponds to the date of the most earlier commit among all the students and the maximum date is the date of the last refresh of the data

QUESTIONS-COMPLETION.1: You can select one of the TP groups to compute only the commits of the students corresponding to the group
QUESTIONS-COMPLETION.2: Moving the cursor delimits the maximum date for which commits are computed
QUESTIONS-COMPLETION.3: Change the index of the red threshold bar by moving the cursor
QUESTIONS-COMPLETION.4: Passing the cursor over a bar displays details on the type of commit the bar corresponds to and the corresponding students
QUESTIONS-COMPLETION.INTRO: This page shows the rate of completion of questions within a TP group, allowing the teacher to plan reviews and corrections at the best possible time
QUESTIONS-COMPLETION.INFO-3: The threshold can be between 10 and 90 and by step of 10

METADATA.1: When a start date is specified, commits before this date are not processed
METADATA.2: When an end date is entered, commits after this date are not processed
METADATA.3: Enter here the questions you want to handle
METADATA.INTRO: It is here that you can modify data such as the document title, program, course and year. It is also possible to define a start date before which commits will not be processed, in the same way as it is possible to define an end date. Lastly, it is possible to define the subject's questions in ascending order
METADATA.WARNING-3: The questions must be completed in ascending order of progress
METADATA.INFO-3: Only the questions provided here will be handled by the application (milestones, graphs)

INVALID-JSON: The file is not a valid JSON file.
QUESTION: Question

EDIT-REPOSITORIES.MESSAGE-INVALID-URL: You must have access to the repository !

CONFIGURATION.UNSAVED-DESCRIPTION-1: You have modified data without saving it. If you leave this page you will lose these changes.
CONFIGURATION.UNSAVED-DESCRIPTION-2: Do you want to leave the page ?

MESSAGE-UNSAVED-GUARD: If you leave this page, you will lose the unsaved changes. Do you want to leave the page ?

EDIT-SESSIONS.MESSAGE-ENDTIME-BEFORE-STARTTIME: The end time must be later than the start time !

MODAL-ADD-REPOSITORIES.TITLE: Add repositories
MODAL-ADD-REPOSITORIES.PLACEHOLDER-TPGROUP: Write the TP group for all selected repositories

ERROR-MESSAGE-COMMITS-NOT-FOUND: You do not have access to the repository
ERROR-MESSAGE-README-NAME-NOT-FOUND: The student's name was not found in the ReadMe file
ERROR-MESSAGE-README-TPGROUP-NOT-FOUND: The TP group was not found
ERROR-TITLE-README-TPGROUP-NOT-FOUND: Error : unable to find the TP group
ERROR-MESSAGE-ERROR-OCCURED:
There were errors while loading the data.
They shouldn't be a problem, but you can see the details in the repositories configuration panel.
